alert.note: Alert for De Soto (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 6:34PM CST until January 23 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, Bossier, Caddo and De Soto and northeast Texas, including the following counties, Cass, Gregg, Harrison, Marion, Panola and Rusk. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Over 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Marshall, Henderson, Carthage, Vivian, Hallsville, Greenwood, Blanchard, Waskom, Jefferson, Benton, Stonewall, Tatum, Plain Dealing, Oil City, Beckville, Mooringsport, Hosston and Rodessa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
